1190203172
Problem: crossword
Summary: Crossword Scanning
Weight: 650
Time limit: 0.5 second(s)
Memory limit: 32 MB
Test cases: 12
Description:
Given a solved Crossword (a matrix of characters) of size m rows x n columns, where each character is either an lowercase alphabet or '*' (indicating non-character block), you have to print all the words used in the crossword. You know that all the words used are more than 1 character long. In a normal crossword if there is any consecutive characters horizontally or vertically, it is a word if it is not a substring of another word (longer in length) overlapping that word. You have to print only unique words in lexicographically sorted order.

Clarified: Words can go only from left to right and from top to bottom in the crossword.
Formatting/Constraints:
  • Input:
    1. Line 1: m n (1 <= m, n <= 50)
    2. Line 2..m+1: Strings of length n giving the contents of each row.
  • Output:
    1. List of words in lexicographically sorted order, one per line.
Examples:
  1. Input: 
    4 4
abcd
b**a
c**b
aaaa
    Output: 
    aaaa
abca
abcd
daba
    Analysis:
    Only four words in this crossword. Note that order of output is important.
  2. Input: 
    4 4
abcd
ef**
gh**
ij*k
    Output: 
    abcd
aegi
bfhj
ef
gh
ij
    Analysis:
    Note that a single character is not a word.
